newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico crude port Dos Bocas reopens - port.
newsitem.headline: Mexico crude port Dos Bocas reopens - port.

text.p: Mexico's crude port Dos Bocas reopened at 0640 local/1140 GMT on Wednesday after days of stormy weather in the Gulf of Mexico, port officials said.
Port captain Jose Manuel Sanchez told Reuters four crude tankers -- named Neptune Subaru, Icaro, Flinders and Waneta -- were held up because of the closure.

Dos Bocas, the nation's second largest crude port, reopened at 1825 local/2325 GMT on Monday after originally closing Saturday afternoon, only to close to exports again at 0615 local/1115 GMT on Tuesday.
Officials said dangerous waves of up to 12 feet high prompted the second closure. Waves early Wednesday were clocked at six to eight feet high.

Dos Bocas exported an average of 505,900 barrels per day (bpd) of crude in 1996, Pajaritos exported about 416,200 bpd and Cayo Arcas shipped an average 576,300 bpd, according to the latest state oil and gas monopoly Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) figures.
